scenario:
The US stock market is experiencing a sell-off after a remarkable run since 2023, creating opportunities for dividend investors to buy high-quality stocks at lower prices. Four blue-chip dividend stocks worth considering for potential January buys are Bank of America, Aflac, CME Group, and Visa. 

Bank of America has paid and raised its dividend for 11 consecutive years, with a current payout ratio of 32% of estimated 2024 earnings. Analysts estimate 10% annual earnings growth for the next three to five years, potentially leading to double-digit dividend increases. The stock yields 2.3% at its current price.

Aflac has raised its dividend for 42 consecutive years, with a recent increase of 16%. The dividend is only 27% of 2024 earnings estimates, and analysts believe the company will grow by nearly 7% annually over the long term. The stock yields 1.9% today.

CME Group operates four exchanges in the financial markets, turning 60% of its revenue into free cash flow to fund a quarterly dividend it has raised 14 years. Analysts believe the company will continue to grow earnings by an average of 5% annually, adding to the stock's 4.4% yield.

Visa is a highly profitable payment network that collects a small fee each time someone swipes their Visa-branded credit or debit card. The company has paid and raised its dividend each year since going public, a streak of 16 years. The stock only yields 0.74%, but it's poised for years of double-digit increases thanks to a 21% payout ratio and anticipated 13% annual earnings growth over the next three to five years.
